member.name: T:Prism.Modularity.ModuleCatalogBase
member.summary:
The holds information about the modules that can be used by the application. Each module is described in a class, that records the name, type and location of the module.
It also verifies that the is internally valid. That means that it does not have:
Circular dependencies
Missing dependencies
Invalid dependencies, such as a Module that's loaded at startup that depends on a module that might need to be retrieved.
The also serves as a baseclass for more specialized Catalogs .

member.name: T:Prism.Mvvm.ViewModelLocationProvider
member.summary: The ViewModelLocationProvider class locates the view model for the view that has the AutoWireViewModelChanged attached property set to true. The view model will be located and injected into the view's DataContext. To locate the view model, two strategies are used: First the ViewModelLocationProvider will look to see if there is a view model factory registered for that view, if not it will try to infer the view model using a convention based approach. This class also provides methods for registering the view model factories, and also to override the default view model factory and the default view type to view model type resolver.

member.summary: A dictionary that contains all the registered factories for the views.

member.name: T:System.ExceptionExtensions
member.summary: Class that provides extension methods for the Exception class. These extension methods provide a mechanism for developers to get more easily to the root cause of an exception, especially in combination with DI-containers such as Unity.

member.name: M:System.ExceptionExtensions.RegisterFrameworkExceptionType(System.Type)
member.summary: Register the type of an Exception that is thrown by the framework. The method uses this list of Exception types to find out if something has gone wrong.
member.param: The type of exception to register.

member.name: M:System.ExceptionExtensions.IsFrameworkExceptionRegistered(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether the exception type is already registered using the method
member.param: The type of framework exception to find.
member.returns: true if the exception type is already registered; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.ExceptionExtensions.GetRootException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Looks at all the inner exceptions of the parameter to find the most likely root cause of the exception. This works by skipping all registered exception types.
member.remarks: This method is not 100% accurate and should only be used to point a developer into the most likely direction. It should not be used to replace the Inner Exception stack of an exception, because this might hide required exception information.
member.param: The exception that will provide the list of inner exeptions to examine.
member.returns: The exception that most likely caused the exception to occur. If it can't find the root exception, it will return the value itself.
